intro: Galium grossheimii, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Galium grossheimii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
